Enforcement.title: Enforcement
Enforcement.headline: Purpose of this technology
Enforcement.description: Used for enforcement of rules or regulations. Find out more here

Energy Efficiency.title: Energy Efficiency
Energy Efficiency.headline: Purpose of this technology
Energy Efficiency.description:
Reduces energy use and/or helps conserve energy. Find out more about energy 
efficiency and energy conservation

Mobility.title: Mobility
Mobility.headline: Purpose of this technology
Mobility.description: Supports how people and materials move around. Find out more here

Inform.title: Inform
Inform.headline: Purpose of this technology
Inform.description:
Supports the provision of information, for example about a location, a 
service, or to provide assistance

Planning & Decision-making.title: Planning & Decision-making
Planning & Decision-making.headline: Purpose of this technology
Planning & Decision-making.description:
Supports the development of future plans; or to enable or measure the 
impact of a decision. Examples include urban planning

Safety & Security.title: Safety & Security
Safety & Security.headline: Purpose of this technology
Safety & Security.description:
Enables a safe and/or secure environment, for example for the purposes of fire 
safety, home security or ensuring safe passage in places such as airports 
or roads

Accessibility.title: Accessibility
Accessibility.headline: Purpose of this technology
Accessibility.description:
Ensures that everyone has equal access to a space or a service. Find out 
more about accessibility and universal design

Ecology.title: Ecology
Ecology.headline: Purpose of this technology
Ecology.description:
Supports the measurement or monitoring of the natural environment. Find 
out more about the natural environment, ecology and environmental science

Waste Management.title: Waste Management
Waste Management.headline: Purpose of this technology
Waste Management.description:
Supports the handling and disposal of waste, including as recyclables, 
compost and [hazardous materials] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hazardous_waste}. Find out more about waste 
management

Water Efficiency.title: Water Efficiency
Water Efficiency.headline: Purpose of this technology
Water Efficiency.description:
Reduces water use and/or helps conserve water. Find out more about water 
efficiency and conservation, and green infrastructure.

Fire & Emergency.title: Fire & Emergency
Fire & Emergency.headline: Purpose of this technology
Fire & Emergency.description:
Supports services that ensure public safety and health related to 
emergencies. Find out more about emergency services.

Health.title: Health
Health.headline: Purpose of this technology
Health.description:
Supports the measurement or monitoring of the aspects of the physical 
environment that impacts human health, such as radiation or air quality, or 
in specific contexts such as the workplace. Find out more about environmental 
monitoring and occupational health and safety

Agency & Interaction.title: Agency & Interaction
Agency & Interaction.headline: Purpose of this technology
Agency & Interaction.description:
Enables you to control or interact with aspects of a space or a 
technology. Find out more about interactive media and virtual reality

Switch.title: Switch
Switch.headline: Purpose of this technology
Switch.description:
Supports a mechanical function - such as turning a device on or off, 
opening or closing, or adjusting brightness and intensity.

Research & Development.title: Research & Development
Research & Development.headline: Purpose of this technology
Research & Development.description: Supports exploratory research and testing. Find out more here

Entry.title: Entry
Entry.headline: Purpose of this technology
Entry.description:
Supports authentication or validation in order to access a space or a 
service. Find out more here

Arts & Culture.title: Arts & Culture
Arts & Culture.headline: Purpose of this technology
Arts & Culture.description: Enables artistic and/or cultural expression. Find out more here

Connectivity.title: Connectivity
Connectivity.headline: Purpose of this technology
Connectivity.description: Enables connectivity of devices to a digital network. Find out more here

Logistics.title: Logistics
Logistics.headline: Purpose of this technology
Logistics.description: Supports the movements of goods or materials. Find out more here

Video camera.title: Video camera
Video camera.headline: How this technology works
Video camera.description: Collects video footage. Find out more here.

Video camera - infrared.title: Video camera - infrared
Video camera - infrared.headline: How this technology works
Video camera - infrared.description:
Collects video footage in the infrared portion of the electromagnetic 
spectrum.

Still camera.title: Still camera
Still camera.headline: How this technology works
Still camera.description: Collects still images. Find out more about cameras here

Still camera - infrared.title: Still camera - infrared
Still camera - infrared.headline: How this technology works
Still camera - infrared.description:
Collects still images in the infrared portion of the electromagnetic 
spectrum.

Assistance Station.title: Assistance Station
Assistance Station.headline: How this technology works
Assistance Station.description:
Provides access to assistive services. Examples include assistive 
technologies and virtual assistants

Microphone.title: Microphone
Microphone.headline: How this technology works
Microphone.description: A device that collects audio. Find out more here

Passive Infrared Sensor.title: Passive Infrared Sensor
Passive Infrared Sensor.headline: How this technology works
Passive Infrared Sensor.description:
An electronic sensor that measures infrared (IR) light radiating from 
objects in its field of view. Find out more here

Soil Moisture Sensor.title: Soil Moisture Sensor
Soil Moisture Sensor.headline: How this technology works
Soil Moisture Sensor.description:
Soil moisture sensors measures the water content in soil. Find out more 
here

Water Quality.title: Water Quality
Water Quality.headline: How this technology works
Water Quality.description:
Measures various aspects of water quality, such as the amount of dissolved 
oxygen in water, pH, nitrates and dissolved oxygen. Find out more here

Sound Level Meter.title: Sound Level Meter
Sound Level Meter.headline: How this technology works
Sound Level Meter.description:
Takes acoustic measurements, most typically for measuring noise pollution. 
Find out more here

Radar.title: Radar
Radar.headline: How this technology works
Radar.description:
Uses radio waves to detect objects, or measure how they are moving through 
a space, such as vehicles. Find out more here

LiDAR.title: LiDAR
LiDAR.headline: How this technology works
LiDAR.description:
Uses lasers to measure distances to objects, collecting data that can 
create a 3-D representation of the object. Find out more here

Air Quality.title: Air Quality
Air Quality.headline: How this technology works
Air Quality.description:
Measures various aspects of air quality, such as pollen, particulate matter, 
ozone, and greenhouse gases. Find out more here

Weather Station.title: Weather Station
Weather Station.headline: How this technology works
Weather Station.description:
A set of instruments for measuring atmospheric conditions such as 
temperature, precipitation, wind speed and direction, and barometric 
pressure. Find out more here

Wireless Access Point.title: Wireless Access Point
Wireless Access Point.headline: How this technology works
Wireless Access Point.description:
Provides wireless access to a wired computer network, or to the internet. 
Find out more here

RFID.title: RFID
RFID.headline: How this technology works
RFID.description:
Enables the identification of items using electromagnetic fields, commonly 
used to track inventory in stores, but not for identifying individual 
items. Find out more here

NFC.title: NFC
NFC.headline: How this technology works
NFC.description:
A wireless communication protocol for electronic devices that are within a 
short distance of each other, typically used in ticketing or payment 
systems. No identifying data is collected in this case. Find out more here

Weighing Scale.title: Weighing Scale
Weighing Scale.headline: How this technology works
Weighing Scale.description:
A weighing scale is a device to measure weight or mass. No identifying 
data is collected in this case. Find out more here

Thermometer.title: Thermometer
Thermometer.headline: How this technology works
Thermometer.description:
Measures the temperature of or changes of temperature in the physical 
environment, and quantifies those attributes according to a standardized 
scale such as Celsius or Fahrenheit. Find more more here

Identifiable NFC.title: Identifiable NFC
Identifiable NFC.headline: How this technology works
Identifiable NFC.description:
A wireless communication protocol for electronic devices that are within a 
short distance of each other, typically used in ticketing or payment 
systems. In this case, unique identification is possible, for example if a 
particular item is closely associated with an individual's personal data. 
Find out more here

Identifiable RFID.title: Identifiable RFID
Identifiable RFID.headline: How this technology works
Identifiable RFID.description:
Enables the identification of items using electromagnetic fields, commonly 
used to track inventory in stores. In this case, unique identification is 
possible, for example if a particular item is closely associated with an 
individual's personal data. Find out more here

Identifiable Video.title: Identifiable Video
Identifiable Video.headline: How this technology works
Identifiable Video.description:
Collects video footage of a sufficient resolution where individuals can be 
identified, for example by capturing images of faces or unique numbers such 
as vehicle license plates. Identifying information can be collected either 
through manual review by a person, or through computer vision techniques 
that derives information in the form of data from video or images.

Identifiable Voice.title: Identifiable Voice
Identifiable Voice.headline: How this technology works
Identifiable Voice.description:
Audio data is collected that does or can identify individuals, either 
through manual review or by technologies that can determine either what is 
being said, or who is saying it. Find out more about speech recognition or speaker 
recognition.

Identifiable Image.title: Identifiable Image
Identifiable Image.headline: How this technology works
Identifiable Image.description:
Collects still images of a sufficient resolution where individuals can be 
identified, for example by capturing images of faces or unique numbers such 
as vehicle license plates. Identifying information can be collected either 
through manual review of images by a person, or through computer vision 
techniques that derives information in the form of data from images.

De-identified Video.title: De-identified Video
De-identified Video.headline: How this technology works
De-identified Video.description:
Collects video footage of a sufficient resolution where individuals can be 
identified, for example by capturing images of faces or unique numbers such 
as vehicle license plates. However, the video is processed in a way that 
removes identifying characteristics before it is used or stored (known as *de-identified 
before first use* or *de-identified on device*), for example by blurring 
faces using computer vision. Find out more about de-identification

De-identified Image.title: De-identified Image
De-identified Image.headline: How this technology works
De-identified Image.description:
Collects still images of a sufficient resolution where individuals can be 
identified, for example by capturing images of faces or unique numbers such 
as vehicle license plates. However, images are processed in a way that 
removes identifying characteristics before it is used or stored (known as *de-identified 
before first use* or *de-identified on device*), for example by blurring 
faces using computer vision. Find out more about de-identification

De-identified Voice.title: De-identified Voice
De-identified Voice.headline: How this technology works
De-identified Voice.description:
Audio data is collected that does or can identify individuals, either 
through manual review or technologies that can determine either what is 
being said, or who is saying it. Find out more about speech recognition or speaker 
recognition. Data is processed in a way that removes identifying 
characteristics before it is used or stored (known as *de-identified before 
first use* or *de-identified on device*). Find out more here

Values / Time.title: Values / Time
Values / Time.headline: Type of data collected
Values / Time.description:
Measurements that are collected at regular intervals over a period of 
time. For example see [time series data] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_series).

Pixel-based Image.title: Pixel-based Image
Pixel-based Image.headline: Type of data collected
Pixel-based Image.description:
A digital image is composed of a grid of individual pixels. Find out more 
at [digital image] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_image)

Boolean.title: Boolean
Boolean.headline: Type of data collected
Boolean.description:
Data that has one of two data values, for example true and false. Find out 
more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boolean_data_type)

Tabular.title: Tabular
Tabular.headline: Type of data collected
Tabular.description:
Data that is stored in a table, where values are stored in rows and 
columns. More [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_(information))

Spatial.title: Spatial
Spatial.headline: Type of data collected
Spatial.description:
Data that represents a location, such as an address, a place name or 
geographic coordinates; or a structure, such as a floorplan. Find out more 
about [geospatial data] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geographic_data_and_information) and 
[building information models] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Building_information_modeling)

Binary.title: Binary
Binary.headline: Type of data collected
Binary.description:
Compressed data into a binary format. Find out more [here] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_file)

RDUA Approved.title: RDUA Approved
RDUA Approved.headline: Describes a review process conducted before this technology was implemented
RDUA Approved.description:
Data activity has undergone a Responsible Data Use Assessment and 
determined to provide a net benefit. The RDUA is a process that Sidewalk 
Labs conducts prior to the start of any data activity.

Reviewed Internally.title: Reviewed Internally
Reviewed Internally.headline: Describes a review process conducted before this technology was implemented
Reviewed Internally.description:
"Many organizations have internal review processes that consider the 
potential benefits, risks and implications for privacy for new technologies 
or data collection activities. For example, in Canada, Privacy Impact 
Assessments are often conducted by organizations prior to the beginning for 
a project - find out more [here] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Privacy_Impact_Assessment). *This could be 
customized with the details of the accountable entity responsible for these 
instances of technology in the public realm*

Encrypted.title: Encrypted
Encrypted.headline: Describes how data collected or handled by a technology is processed or manipulated
Encrypted.description:
Data has been encoded so that only authorized parties can access it, which 
can reduce risk related to handling private or sensitive information. Find 
out more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption)

Aggregated.title: Aggregated
Aggregated.headline: Describes how data collected or handled by a technology is processed or manipulated
Aggregated.description:
"Data that has been grouped or summarized from individual measurements, 
for example to count up totals or to calculate an average. Find out more 
[here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aggregate_data)

Raw data.title: Raw data
Raw data.headline: Describes how data collected or handled by a technology is processed or manipulated
Raw data.description:
"Data that has not been processed or altered from the point of collection 
- the data is effectively identical to how it was gathered from the 
original data source. Find out more [here] (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raw_data)

Regulated.title: Regulated
Regulated.headline: A regulatory entity has oversight of this technology or data activity
Regulated.description:
Depending on the jurisdiction and type of data, data is regulated in 
various ways. For example, Personal Information in Canada is regulated by 
federal, provincial, and municipal laws. The collection, use and disclosure 
of Personal Information by private companies in Ontario is regulated by the 
[Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act] (
https://www.priv.gc.ca/en/privacy-topics/privacy-laws-in-canada/the-personal-information-protection-and-electronic-documents-act-pipeda/) 
*This should be customized for the jurisdiction where this digital channel 
is being used*

AI System.title: AI System
AI System.headline: Describes how data collected or handled by a technology is processed or manipulated
AI System.description:
Data that is processed by automated, algorithmic or artificial 
intelligence systems to derive a new result or data point. Find out more 
about [automated] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automated_decision_support), 
[algorithmic] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithm) and [artificial 
intelligence] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) 
systems.

De-identified.title: De-identified
De-identified.headline: Describes how data collected or handled by a technology is processed or manipulated
De-identified.description:
Data that is processed to remove identifying values, usually to protect 
privacy. De-identification can happen at any point in a data collection 
process, for example before it is stored in a database, or before it is 
published. Here we define it to mean after the data has already left a 
hardware device, or after it has been stored in a database. Find out more 
[here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De-identification)

Available to download.title: Available to download
Available to download.headline: The data can be accessed and downloaded online, either for free or for a fee.
Available to download.description:
Data that can be accessed and downloaded online, either for free or for a 
fee

Available to 3rd parties.title: Available to 3rd parties
Available to 3rd parties.headline: The data is available to 3rd parties not involved in the data activity. This does not always mean that data is being resold.
Available to 3rd parties.description:
Data is available to 3rd parties not involved in the data activity. This 
does not always mean that data is being resold.

Available to me.title: Available to me
Available to me.headline: The data is available to you but not to other individuals. For example, as an individual you have access to all your electronic toll records for your car, but other individuals do not have access to that.
Available to me.description:
Available to me but not to other individuals. For example, as an 
individual you have access to all your electronic toll records for your 
car, but other individuals do not have access to that.

Not available to me.title: Not available to me
Not available to me.headline: The data is not available to you or other individuals. As an individual, there isn't a way for you to access this data.
Not available to me.description:
Not available to me or other individuals. As an individual, there isn't a 
way for you to access this data.

Available for resale.title: Available for resale
Available for resale.headline: The data collected may be resold to other 3rd parties.
Available for resale.description: The data collected may be resold to other 3rd parties

Not available to the accountable organiz.title: Not available to the accountable organization
Not available to the accountable organiz.headline: The data is not available to the accountable organization.
Not available to the accountable organiz.description:
Data is not available to the accountable organization *this can be 
customized*

Not available to vendor.title: Not available to vendor
Not available to vendor.headline: Data is not available to the data collection or technology provider *this can be customized*
Not available to vendor.description:
Data is not available to the data collection or technology provider *this 
can be customized*

Available to the accountable organizatio.title: Available to the accountable organization
Available to the accountable organizatio.headline: The data is available to the accountable organization.
Available to the accountable organizatio.description: Data is available to the accountable organization *this can be customized*

Available to vendor.title: Available to vendor
Available to vendor.headline: The data is available to the data collection or technology provider.
Available to vendor.description:
Data is available to the data collection or technology provider *this can 
be customized*

Stored on 3rd Party Cloud.title: Stored on 3rd Party Cloud
Stored on 3rd Party Cloud.headline: Where is the data stored?
Stored on 3rd Party Cloud.description:
Data is stored on behalf of the organization or the data collector in an 
off-site data centre, such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud and 
Microsoft Azure

No data retained.title: No data retained
No data retained.headline: How long is the data kept?
No data retained.description: No data is kept or stored

Retained 24 hours.title: Retained 24 hours
Retained 24 hours.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained 24 hours.description: Data is stored for 24 hours, and after this time period is deleted

Retained 1 month.title: Retained 1 month
Retained 1 month.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained 1 month.description: Data is stored for 1 month, and after this time period is deleted

Retained 3 months.title: Retained 3 months
Retained 3 months.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained 3 months.description: Data is stored for 3 months, and after this time period is deleted

Retained for *time period*.title: Retained for *time period*
Retained for *time period*.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained for *time period*.description:
Data is stored for *a customized time period*, and after this time period 
is deleted

Retained 1 year.title: Retained 1 year
Retained 1 year.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained 1 year.description: Data is stored for 1 year, and after this time period is deleted

Retained 5 years.title: Retained 5 years
Retained 5 years.headline: How long is the data kept?
Retained 5 years.description: Data is stored for 5 years, and after this time period is deleted

Retained indefinitely.title: Retained indefinitely
Retained indefinitely.headline: How long is the data kept?

Stored locally.title: Stored locally
Stored locally.headline: Where is the data stored?
Stored locally.description:
Data is stored in the jurisdiction where it was collected. Find out more 
[here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_sovereignty)

Stored primarily locally.title: Stored primarily locally
Stored primarily locally.headline: Where is the data stored?
Stored primarily locally.description:
Data is stored mainly in the jurisdiction where it was collected. Find out 
more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_sovereignty)

Stored primarily internationally.title: Stored primarily internationally
Stored primarily internationally.headline: Where is the data stored?
Stored primarily internationally.description:
Data is stored outside the jurisdiction where it was collected. Find out 
more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_sovereignty)

Backed up locally.title: Backed up locally
Backed up locally.headline: Where is the data stored?
Backed up locally.description:
Data is backed up with the jurisdiction where it was collected. Find out 
more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_sovereignty)

Backed up internationally.title: Backed up internationally
Backed up internationally.headline: Where is the data stored?
Backed up internationally.description:
Data is backed up outside the jurisdiction where it was collected. Find 
out more [here] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_sovereignty)
